ygData.subject: Re: Train etiquette
ygData.msgSnippet: Hm. Almost seems like a better question is, what s the _character s_ proper etiquette? I mean, if they re training, they re hopefully doing it because they re
ygData.messageBody:
Hm. Almost seems like a better question is,
what's the _character's_ proper etiquette? I mean, if
they're training, they're hopefully doing it because
they're in trouble. They could be doing it to be a
jackass and/or for payback to someone who KS'd them or
something . . . But I guess my related point is that if
it's a valid "trouble" train, then they should have
shouted, and you should feel free to jump in. After all,
you're only defending yourself.<br><br>I sometimes pull
trains on purpose - Butcherblock is great for this
because it has so many guards. Once, when I needed
something off one of the bandits I did this: With SoW on
me, I attacked the one I needed, got jumped by four
bandits, killed the target, then took off for the guards
to let them finish the job. I shouted out "Bandit
train to Crossroads!" and hightailed it. Someone tried
to help, but said he was too slow. No problem,
wasn't looking for help anyway, just trying to warn
folks on the road.<br> <br>Another time I got jumped by
some goblins that I couldn't handle, so I ran (again
for Crossroads). Didn't quite have typing and running
down at the same time, but I did have a wide-angle
view on. Saw that a bunch of folks were fighting
Zarchoomi and/or Corflunk (big Ogres), so I detoured around
them. Figured they didn't need the extra grief.
<br><br>So, I would jump in, because is someone is training,
they're hopefully in trouble, and if not, it's free
experience, if you can handle it.<br><br>Kharlisht of
Kaladim<br>11th season rogue<br>Drinal
